summary: Enthusiastic, highly motivated educator dedicated to instilling in children the passion to become life-long learners; seeking Enrichment Specialist position.
skills: Microsoft Windows XP Professional (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Publisher)

experience.title: Teacher
experience.description: Executed lesson plans and evaluated effectiveness through assessment and reflection; created visual supports using technology to enhance and differentiate instruction; used the Go Math, Eureka, Engage NY, IXL & Khan Academy resources to provide math instruction; led inquiry-based student investigations for the FOSS Science Program using Next Generation Standards; worked with the Common Core & Next Generation Standards to provide structured instruction; provided Smarter Balanced NWEA Test Preparation for Mathematics & Science; created instructional materials and strategies consistent with student learning and behavioral needs; utilized the Positive Behavior Support (PBS) Program; collaborated with grade partners to provide consistent instruction and to develop and implement grade-level goals; updated a teacher Infinite Campus with homework, grades and events to extend parental and student communication.

experience.title: 6th Grade Teacher
experience.description: Provided a balanced literacy program to fifth graders based on Shelton's curriculum goal of the whole, small, whole Reader's Workshop Model; used various strategies and procedures for small group instruction to increase student growth in vocabulary, fluency, and comprehension; utilized technology across multiple content areas; taught strategies for previewing books and choosing a book that is 'just-right'; provided Writing Instruction through the Writer's Workshop model; utilized the Houghton Mifflin Anthology to model meta-cognitive reading strategies; supplemented curriculum with various non-fiction texts; utilized Literacy Work Stations during small group instruction (Independent Daily Reading Station, Word Study Station, CMT Strand Work Station); provided small group instruction based on analysis of weak CMT strands in Reading, Writing, and Math; administered and analyzed Developmental Reading Assessment (DRA 2); provided CT Mastery Test Preparation for Reading, Writing, Mathematics, and Science; created instructional materials and strategies consistent with student learning and behavioral needs; utilized the Positive Behavior Support (PBS) Program to provide positive reinforcement as a preventive measure for disruptive and/or inappropriate behavior.

experience.title: Special Education Tutor
experience.description: Modified math curriculum and created worksheets for a sixth grade student in accordance with IEP objectives; created accommodated quizzes, tests, lesson and study guides for sixth grade Social Studies curriculum; provided small group instruction for core content subjects in K-6 general education classrooms; provided assistance to general education teacher using the Inclusion Model for instruction; Assess Kindergarten students using Shelton Public Schools Assessment; Administer Brigance Inventory of Basic Skills to special education students; Administer CMT's to special education students; provide accommodations during sixth grade Writer's Workshop for a group of six students; planned and implemented an introduction to the 6th grade Science Embedded Task utilizing the Scientific Method; Create visual supports using technology to enhance and to differentiate instruction; Observe and assist with Everyday Mathematics, Wilson Reading, Houghton Mifflin, Scott Foresman Social Studies lesson, CMT Prep, and Literature Circles.

education.degree: NCATE Endorsement: Remedial Reading and Remedial Language Arts, Grades K-12 (102 Certification)

certifications: NCATE Endorsement, National Council for Accreditation of Teacher Education
Connecticut Collaboration (Elementary Regular Education/Special Education) (013, 165 certifications)
Remedial Reading and Remedial Language Arts, Grades K-12 (102 Certification)
